name: DrDoctor
description:
Vision

To solve the challenge of rising demand and rising costs in Healthcare
We see a future where smart healthcare systems mean everyone has personalised, high-quality care, delivered when and where it’s needed.

Dr Doctor Mission

Improve the quality, value and timeliness of each interaction between hospitals and patients. We’ll do this by building the digital patient layer and supporting our partner hospitals on their journey to delivering outcomes.

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
**What do we want? Business Development Manager. When do we want you? Now!**

We are on the lookout for a Business Development Manager with NHS sales experience to join our expanding sales team.

Whilst the ultimate role of a BDM is to “close the deal”, our approach is a lot more consultative. The NHS are our client and the patient experience is at the heart of what we do. You will have an appreciation for a longer and certainly more complex sales process yet be a techy at heart and can quickly get to grips with our product inside and out.

Responsibilities include:

- You will be the engine of DrDoctor – ensuring that the business can continue to grow through delivering exceptional partnerships with our clients.
- You will be measured on your Sales performance and will be responsible for prospects across multiple stages of the sales process. 
- Pitch DrDoctor to multiple layers of seniority within the NHS and know how to add value in conversation, whatever the scenario. 
- As the face of DrDoctor, you will keep the business up to date with how contracts are progressing and meet monthly and annual KPI’s.
- Coach and champion the SDR team to help them with appointment setting.
- Liaise with all parts of the DrDoctor team to ensure effective implementation of our services for our customers.

**OK, That’s me, but who are you?**

DrDoctor is a fast-growing digital health company founded in 2012. Our technology improves appointment scheduling, increases clinic efficiency by reducing no-shows and fills empty slots. We save the NHS millions of pounds each year and are currently deployed across 22 major hospitals around the UK including Guy’s and St Thomas’ & Great Ormond Street. With over 7 million patients active on the platform already, we’re on a journey to deliver the tools to radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and tax payers.

**Tell me more! Who will I be working with?**

Hi, I’m Chloe. I'm token Kiwi #2! I've been working in health tech for the last 7 years and moved to sunny London in 2014. I've held a few different roles in that time, and most recently have been enjoying the world of sales. I'm excited by DrDoctor's current traction in the market and our pipeline is sure to keep us busy. Aside from that, we work in an amazing team - hard-working, clever and the friendliest bunch! To be a success at DrDoctor you need to be a team player and being self-motivated will really help.

**OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?**

- You know how to adapt your style to varying levels of people within the NHS.
- Would be useful to have an existing network of decision makers within secondary care.
- You are a consultative seller, you are already working with longer and complex sales cycles.
- Have the ability to simplify a complex set of problems and structure the right solution for our clients - this may include project planning, technical understanding etc. 
- You excel in a high growth environment, and love getting the work done right.
- Can work across multiple levels of an organisation, and you understand that the receptionist is as important as the CEO.
- Motivated to take the early train to meet a prospect, because you know how much face time matters.
- You are passionate about our mission.
- Ideally you have a working knowledge of the NHS.
- You are able to demonstrate you have meet or exceeded your current and previous sales targets.

**We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?**

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CV’s to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual response if it’s not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30-minute call. It’s just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue, then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Depending on your role we may also ask you to complete an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

**I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?**

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

Benefits include: Flexible working (work where you are at you best and at times where you are your most productive), 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, discretionary bonus, Summer rooftop party, Christmas extravaganza, yearly ski trip, yoga on a Monday and lunch and beer every other Friday!

Salary competitive and dependant on experience.  
  
We check all our job adverts to insure we build a diverse team: [http://gender-decoder.katmatfield.com/results/b9ee05cc-5a8e-4788-aed1-ff51cc579072](https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fgender-decoder.katmatfield.com%2Fresults%2Fb9ee05cc-5a8e-4788-aed1-ff51cc579072)

jobs.title: Delivery Analyst
jobs.description:
**What do we want? A Delivery Analyst. When do we want you? Now!**

We are on the lookout for a few Delivery Analyst’s to join the team

The transformation team is on hand for every hospital that uses the DrDoctor Platform to ensure they get the most out of it. At DrDoctor we want every installation of our platform to deliver the best possible results at every hospital, without exception. We help our partner hospitals through every step of the way. Over many years, we have come to be experts not only in delivering technology but also in transforming hospital services from the ground up.

You must be an exceptional planner, do-er and people person. You get how to make things happen in a large organisation and take pleasure in efficient solutions.

**Key Responsibilities include:**

Work to drive forward business processes within a fast-paced start up environment

Data analysis and problem solving to support project delivery

Training customers in ongoing use of the DrDoctor solutions

Running engagement days with client teams to ensure understanding of project aims

Project management of large-scale transformation projects, predominantly within acute NHS trusts

Supporting upselling and new project sales through data analysis and preparation of proposals

Working closely with client teams to implement DrDoctor software solutions and support with change management

Gathering insight from clients in order to inform broader business improvement across product design, client services and sales functions

**OK, That’s me, but who are you?**

DrDoctor is a fast-growing digital health company founded in 2012. Our technology improves appointment scheduling, increases clinic efficiency by reducing no-shows and fills empty slots. We save the NHS millions of pounds each year and are currently deployed across 22 major hospitals around the UK including Guy’s and St Thomas’ & Great Ormond Street. With over 7 million patients active on the platform already, we’re on a journey to deliver the tools to radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and tax payers.

**Tell me more! Who will I be working with?**

In this role you really will interact with every part of the business on a daily basis, even as we grow. But meet Tove…

*Hi, my name is Tove and I am a Service Designer. I have been with DrDoctor for 2 years. There are a lot of things I love about DrDoctor, but fundamentally the healthcare sector is a fascinating and rewarding place to work. The challenge? Managing the intersection between human needs and the needs of a huge organisation under immense pressure. To have a successful career at DrDoctor you must have an ability to really dig in, pull through, and get things done!*

**OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?**

We fully expect that you will need time to develop in your role and we are committed to supporting every step. However, some key skills are:

Improvement management or system implementation background an advantage

NHS knowledge is a definite benefit, but not essential

Personable and tenacious in equal measure

Exceptional reasoning skills

You must be able to understand the technical side of what we do

**We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?**

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CV’s to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual response if its not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. Its just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Depending on your role we may also ask you to complete an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

**I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?**

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

Benefits include: Flexible working (work where you are at you best and at times where you are your most productive), 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, discretionary bonus, Summer rooftop party, Christmas extravaganza, yearly ski trip, yoga on a Monday and lunch and beer every other Friday!

Salary competitive and dependent on experience  
  
**We value diversity and inclusion so we're making an effort to check the language we use in all our postings: [http://gender-decoder.katmatfield.com/results/8e71c541-8eac-43b8-a10f-0d4ead8928fe](https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fgender-decoder.katmatfield.com%2Fresults%2F8e71c541-8eac-43b8-a10f-0d4ead8928fe)**

**Agency note: we do all of our recruitment directly, any unsolicited CVs or profiles sent to us will be viewed as gifts and will not be considered liable for a fee.**

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.description:
**What do we want? Senior Data Engineer (SQL). When do we want you? Now!**

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Engineer (SQL)to help design and implement our next generation data structures.

You will be a lead engineer working on our transactional and reporting databases. As a data engineer you will be creating the production ready pipelines to move and transform the data. These should be scalable, efficient, testable and deployed using our CI/CD tools.

You will be leading on our move from our monolith database to individual data stores per service. You will be responsible for modelling the data objects, designing the structure of the new schemas and improving the performance of queries.

This will be a key role in our nascent data function. You will be working cross-functionally with business domain experts, engineers, product analysts and client delivery teams to understand data and reporting requirements from our BI. You will then be responsible for making sure they have the information they need in order to make key decisions using data.

We have fast and frequent deployments, good test coverage and a young codebase. You will have a direct effect on what we do and how we do it. This role is ideal for candidates with a desire to learn and accelerate their careers. We can give you exposure to every facet of enterprise SaaS software and as much responsibility as you are ready to handle.

**OK, That’s me. But who are you?**

DrDoctor is a fast-growing digital health company founded in 2012. Our technology improves appointment scheduling, increases clinic efficiency by reducing no-shows and fills empty slots. We save the NHS millions of pounds each year and are currently deployed across 22 major hospitals around the UK including Guy’s and St Thomas’ & Great Ormond Street. With over 7 million patients active on the platform already, we’re on a journey to deliver the tools to radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and tax payers.

**Tell me more! Who will I be working with?**

In this role you really will interact with every part of the business on a daily basis, even as we grow.

But meet Joe

*I’m Joe, I work in the marketing team and I have been here for just over a year. I love the idea that my work is contributing towards the improvement of the NHS. To me it’s also the ultimate challenge. How can you take a complex and interconnected web of systems and help them to operate more efficiently? A great question to have at the back of your mind. To succeed at DrDoctor, you need a degree of aptitude, but bags of drive and a willingness to learn both within and beyond your role. We’re a close-knit bunch who all socialise regularly with each other, and our work is fundamentally collaborative, so you must be comfortable working in groups.*

**OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?**

You will need strong experience in scaling and optimizing schemas, performance tuning SQL and ETL pipelines in the OLTP, OLAP and Data Warehouse environments. As well as a solid experience of SSIS you should have hands on experience of other data platforms for moving and transforming (e.g. Azure Data Factory, Spark/Scala).

You should be comfortable in working with people across the business to understand what information they really require and what is the most important. You should understand the different non-SQL data technologies and know when it may be more appropriate to store information in one of those.

We are looking for someone who loves technology and has the drive to push, challenge and grow the company. You’ll need to be as ambitious as we are and revel in the flexible nature and mix of skills required for startup work. We’re primarily office based but supportive of flexible and remote working so days at home or nursery runs are not a problem.

Strong skills/experience in

- SQL (5+ years)
- SSIS/ETL
- Designing OLAP/OLTP data schema
- Performance tuning queries
- Azure platform
  - Azure SQL
  - Data Factory
  - Analysis Services
 
- Analysis/Reporting services
- Managing servers and users (SQL admin)

Some experience in (and/or desire to learn)

Bonus points for:

- Document databases/NoSQL
- Streaming updates to BI
- GitHub profile, blog posts, other online repos 
- Automated testing (one or more of: Unit Testing, Spec Testing, TDD, BDD etc.)
- Healthtech experience
- A desire to learn and grow your skills
- Can explain your point in sprint planning when everyone is looking at you oddly
- Happy to work from a pub on a Friday afternoon

Also Required:

**We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?**

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CV’s to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual response if its not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. Its just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Depending on your role we may also ask you to complete an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

**I can’t wait to get started! What are the perks?**

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

Benefits include: Flexible working (work where you are at you best and at times where you are your most productive), 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, discretionary bonus, Summer rooftop party, Christmas extravaganza, yearly ski trip, yoga on a Monday and lunch and beer every other Friday!

Salary competitive and dependant on experience

Agency note: we do all of our recruitment directly, any unsolicited CVs or profiles sent to us will be viewed as gifts and will not be considered liable for a fee.

jobs.title: Senior UX Designer
jobs.description:
**What do we want? Senior UX Designer! When do we want you? Now!**

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer that can drive the design function and work with the wider team to take our product to the next level. In this role, you should be a creative person who is able to explore and communicate user needs, solve problems and measure your success. A strong portfolio of successful UX projects is essential. The aim is for you to make our product more impactful, user-friendly and competitive.

- Work with an evidence based, user centred and creative approach to improve product outcomes
- Work closely with the product team to define, ship, and improve product features. You aim big but start small.
- Be collaborative and use your emotional intelligence to foster excellent team work and decision making within the product function.
- Make your design tangible through user journeys, sketches, prototypes and wireframes.
- Identify UX performance issues in our existing product and find ways to improve it.
- Work together with product owners and senior management team to ensure the roadmap is informed and validated by research and evidence
- Build a coherent and accessible understanding of our users motivations, activities and needs. On-board the wider team onto your findings.
- Keep up to date with competitor products and industry trends

**OK, That’s me, but who are you?**

DrDoctor is a fast-growing digital health company founded in 2012. Our technology improves appointment scheduling, increases clinic efficiency by reducing no-shows and fills empty slots. We save the NHS millions of pounds each year and are currently deployed across 22 major hospitals around the UK including Guy’s and St Thomas’ & Great Ormond Street. With over 7 million patients active on the platform already, we’re on a journey to deliver the tools to radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and tax payers.

**Tell me more! Who will I be working with?**

Hi there my name is Matt and I've been working as a product owner at DrDoctor for nearly nine months. I love the working environment here: we have some big problems that need creative solutions, and everyone just pitches in together to solve them, every voice gets heard. We have a great product built on solid tech, and over the next couple of years we need to manage the careful balance between making our product even more awesome while moving our platform onto a microservice architecture, API fronted and fully cloud-native. Software is never "done" - it's a journey, not a destination!

**OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?**

- Strong portfolio of design projects
- Proven experience designing and delivering high quality, high impact product solutions in an agile team
- Experience in planning and conducting experiments and user research (qual and quant) that inform tactical and strategic product decisions
- Experience in project planning and management
- Strong knowledge of interaction design principles
- Proficient in design software (e.g. sketch, invision, axure)
- Knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus

**We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?**

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CV’s to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual response if its not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. Its just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Depending on your role we may also ask you to complete an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

**I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?**

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

Benefits include: Flexible working (work where you are at you best and at times where you are your most productive), 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, discretionary bonus, salary reviews every 6 months, Summer rooftop party, Christmas extravaganza, yearly ski trip, yoga on a Monday and lunch and beer every other Friday!

Salary competitive and dependant on experience.

We value diversity and inclusion so we're making an effort to ensure all our job postings are gender neutral: [http://gender-decoder.katmatfield.com/results/ec059913-7e4d-4571-a17e-fc7cdf357c4a](https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fgender-decoder.katmatfield.com%2Fresults%2Fec059913-7e4d-4571-a17e-fc7cdf357c4a)

Agency note: we do all of our recruitment directly, any unsolicited CVs or profiles sent to us will be viewed as gifts and will not be considered liable for a fee.
